filmography.title: No Way Out
filmography.role_description: A pioneering black doctor who must treat a racist criminal while facing hatred and bigotry from the patient's brother.
filmography.plot: A doctor, the first African-American resident at a county hospital, is assigned to treat two racist brothers who have been shot during a robbery.

filmography.title: Cry, the Beloved Country
filmography.role_description: A young, helpful priest in Johannesburg who guides an older country reverend through the city's racial injustices to find his son.
filmography.plot: A black minister searches the perilous city of Johannesburg for his missing son, discovering the harsh realities of apartheid.
filmography.awards: Berlin Int'l Film Festival: Nominee – Golden Bear

filmography.title: Blackboard Jungle
filmography.role_description: A rebellious but musically talented student with leadership potential who eventually sides with his teacher against a violent gang.
filmography.plot: A new English teacher at a violent, unruly inner-city school is determined to do his job, despite resistance from both students and faculty.

filmography.title: Edge of the City
filmography.role_description: A charismatic and optimistic dock worker who befriends a troubled army deserter and stands up to a corrupt union boss.
filmography.plot: An army deserter and a black dock worker join forces against a corrupt union official.

filmography.title: The Defiant Ones
filmography.role_description: An escaped convict chained to a white racist fellow prisoner, forced to work together to survive and evade capture.
filmography.plot: Two escaped convicts, one white and one black, are shackled together and must learn to get along in order to elude capture.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Porgy and Bess
filmography.role_description: A disabled beggar in Charleston's Catfish Row who valiantly attempts to rescue the beautiful Bess from her possessive lover and a drug dealer.
filmography.plot: In 1912 Charleston, a disabled beggar tries to rescue a woman from her violent lover and a drug dealer.

filmography.title: A Raisin in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A frustrated chauffeur with big dreams of using his father's insurance money to open a liquor store and lift his family out of poverty.
filmography.plot: A substantial insurance payment could mean either financial salvation or personal ruin for a poor black family in Chicago.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best Foreign Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: Paris Blues
filmography.role_description: An expatriate jazz saxophonist living in Paris to escape American racism, who falls for a visiting American tourist.
filmography.plot: Two jazz musicians living in Paris meet two American tourists who challenge their decision to live abroad.

filmography.title: Pressure Point
filmography.role_description: A prison psychiatrist who must treat a homegrown American Nazi seditionist, testing his professional detachment.
filmography.plot: A black prison psychiatrist is assigned to treat a patient who is a member of the American Nazi party.

filmography.title: Lilies of the Field
filmography.role_description: An itinerant handyman who reluctantly helps a group of East German nuns build a chapel in the Arizona desert.
filmography.plot: A traveling handyman becomes the answer to the prayers of a group of nuns who wish to build a chapel in the desert.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Bedford Incident
filmography.role_description: A photojournalist aboard a US Navy destroyer who witnesses the captain's obsessive pursuit of a Soviet submarine.
filmography.plot: An American destroyer captain is determined to confront a Soviet submarine caught violating territorial waters.

filmography.title: A Patch of Blue
filmography.role_description: A compassionate office worker who befriends a blind, uneducated white girl, protecting her from her abusive mother.
filmography.plot: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man, who becomes determined to help her escape her abusive home life.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best Foreign Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Slender Thread
filmography.role_description: A student volunteer at a crisis center who tries to keep a suicidal woman on the phone long enough to save her.
filmography.plot: A volunteer at a Seattle crisis center tries to save a woman who has taken an overdose of pills and called the center.

filmography.title: Duel at Diablo
filmography.role_description: A stylish, former Buffalo Soldier turned horse breaker who gets caught up in a cavalry mission and Apache ambush.
filmography.plot: A scout for the US cavalry seeks revenge on the man who killed his Comanche wife while escorting a supply wagon through hostile territory.

filmography.title: To Sir, with Love
filmography.role_description: An out-of-work engineer who takes a teaching job in a tough London East End school and wins over his rebellious students.
filmography.plot: An engineer takes a teaching job at a rough London school and gradually earns the respect of his students.

filmography.title: In the Heat of the Night
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated Philadelphia homicide detective who is wrongfully arrested in Mississippi and then stays to solve a murder case.
filmography.plot: A black Philadelphia police detective is mistakenly suspected of a local murder while passing through a racially hostile Mississippi town.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
filmography.role_description: A brilliant, internationally respected doctor whose engagement to a white woman challenges her liberal parents' beliefs.
filmography.plot: A couple's attitudes are challenged when their daughter introduces them to her African-American fiancé.

filmography.title: For Love of Ivy
filmography.role_description: A suave trucking company executive and illegal casino operator who is blackmailed into dating a family's maid.
filmography.plot: A family blackmails a man into dating their maid to keep her from quitting, but the two end up falling in love.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Abbey Lincoln)

filmography.title: They Call Me Mister Tibbs!
filmography.role_description: Reprising his iconic role, Tibbs investigates a murder in San Francisco while dealing with family issues.
filmography.plot: In this sequel to 'In the Heat of the Night', Virgil Tibbs investigates the murder of a prostitute, with a preacher as the prime suspect.

filmography.title: Buck and the Preacher
filmography.role_description: A wagon master leading former slaves to the West who teams up with a con-man preacher to fight off bounty hunters.
filmography.plot: A wagon master and a con-man preacher help freed slaves pursued by bounty hunters seeking to return them to the South.

filmography.title: Uptown Saturday Night
filmography.role_description: A factory worker who, along with his friend, gets robbed of a winning lottery ticket and must navigate the criminal underworld to get it back.
filmography.plot: Two friends sneak out to visit a high-class illegal club, but trouble ensues when they are robbed of their wallets, one containing a winning lottery ticket.

filmography.title: The Wilby Conspiracy
filmography.role_description: A South African revolutionary who, upon release from prison, goes on the run with a British engineer to escape the secret police.
filmography.plot: An anti-apartheid activist and a British engineer are pursued across South Africa by the country's secret police.

filmography.title: Let's Do It Again
filmography.role_description: A milkman who teams up with his friend to rig a boxing match through hypnotism to raise money for their lodge.
filmography.plot: Two blue-collar friends use hypnotism to rig a boxing match and raise money for their community group.
filmography.awards: NAACP Image Award: Win – Outstanding Actor

filmography.title: Shoot to Kill
filmography.role_description: A veteran FBI agent who teams up with a rugged mountain guide to track a killer through the wilderness.
filmography.plot: An FBI agent and a mountain guide track a killer who has kidnapped the guide's girlfriend and vanished into the wilderness.

filmography.title: Sneakers
filmography.role_description: A former CIA officer and conspiracy theorist who works as part of a team of security specialists.
filmography.plot: A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.
